131 SANS Institute Brings Cybersecurity Training Academy To Greater Chicago: Seeks To Create New Talent In Local InfoSec Pipeline By: SANS Institute via PR Newswire  45 AM EST SANS Institute Brings Cybersecurity Training Academy To Greater Chicago: Seeks To Create New Talent In Local InfoSec Pipeline CHICAGO , Feb. 14, 2018 PRNewswireUSNewswire  As the cybersecurity market continues to grow and it becomes an issue of paramount importance, employers are intently seeking to hire professionals with aptitude and skills to fill key positions. SANS Institute has thus launched the SANS Cyber Workforce Academy  Chicago , a 100 scholarshipbased, immersive training program designed to increase the talent pipeline in the greater Chicago area. This accelerated program is a fasttrack into the cybersecurity field for veterans and women in the region. The SANS Cyber Workforce Academy  Chicago is a threetofour month accelerated cybersecurity training program that offers students advanced technical SANS training and industryrecognized GIAC certifications. Students will learn the handson cyber defense, continuous monitoring, security operations and incident handling skills sought by Chicago area employers. The Academy will aim to recruit veterans and women, building on the success of the SANS VetSuccess and Womens Immersion Academies. Since 2015, these programs have provided scholarshipbased cybersecurity training to more than 225 participants. One of the greatest threats to information security is the dramatic shortage of cyber talent in the U.S. and around the globe, explained Max Shuftan , SANS CyberTalent Program Director. We are excited about the Cyber Workforce Academy  Chicago as this unique program offers veterans and women a way to break into the cybersecurity field and realize their potential in a fastpaced and highdemand industry. The Academy also helps local employers by increasing the number of cybersecurity professionals available to fill key positions. Accepted participants will receive industryleading curriculum and handson learning taught by expert SANS faculty. Graduates earn GIAC certifications  recognized by employers around the world. SANS, using its professional and corporate network developed over the past 25 years, will coordinate introductions between program graduates and leading employers in the greater Chicago area. Applicants must qualify by demonstrating aptitude and foundational skills using the SANS CyberTalent Enhanced CTE Assessment and participate in interviews with SANS staff. Interested candidates may visit www.sans.orgcyberworkforcechicago to view eligibility requirements. Applications for the Cyber Workforce Academy  Chicago are now open and will close on March 30, 2018 . Candidates will be selected by April 13, 2018 and courses begin May 1 st , with graduation estimated in late July 2018 . For more information about or to apply for the SANS Cyber Workforce Academy  Chicago , please visit: www.sans.orgcyberworkforcechicago . About SANS Institute The SANS Institute was established in 1989 as a cooperative research and education organization. SANS is the most trusted and, by far, the largest provider of cybersecurity training and certification to professionals at governments and commercial institutions worldwide. Renowned SANS instructors teach over 50 different courses at more than 200 live cybersecurity training events as well as online. GIAC, an affiliate of the SANS Institute, validates employee qualifications via 30 handson, technical certifications in information security . The SANS Technology Institute, a regionally accredited independent subsidiary, offers masters degrees in cyber security . SANS offers a myriad of free resources to the InfoSec community including consensus projects, research reports, and newsletters it also operates the Internets early warning systemthe Internet Storm Center. At the heart of SANS are the many security practitioners, representing varied global organizations from corporations to universities, working together to help the entire information security community.  www.SANS.org  View original content: http:www.prnewswire.comnewsreleasessansinstitutebringscybersecuritytrainingacademytogreaterchicagoseekstocreatenewtalentinlocalinfosecpipeline300598757.html
132 Top-Ranking Madigan Aide Out After Misconduct Complaints « CBS Chicago Sponsored By TopRanking Madigan Aide Out After Misconduct Complaints As Mike Madigan works to put the Springfield sex harassment scandal behind him, a topranking member of his political team is out. CBS 2s Derrick Blakley reports. Categories: News WBBMTV More WBBMTV 
133 Northwest suburbs work to clear roads as snow continues to fall - Chicago Tribune Although area snowfall totals have fallen short of initial weather forecasts that predicted as much as 14 inches of snow by Friday morning, public works crews in Arlington Heights have been able to keep local streets plowed and salted partly thanks to schools cancelling classes, said Scott Shirley, public works director for Arlington Heights.By early Friday morning, the village had seen about six inches of snow, but the total is expected to grow, Shirley said.Light snow has been forecasted to fall intermittently throughout the day with one to three inches expected by Friday night and an additional one to three inches expected by Sunday morning.This snowfall seems to have scooted south, and they keep changing the forecast, so theres a lot of guesswork involved, Shirley said. But were feeling lucky today because all of the local schools are closed, which in our minds is a good thing, as it takes a lot of the traffic off the roads, and we dont have kids on the sidewalks walking to school.Stacey Wescott  Chicago Tribune Ben Brown uses a snow blower to clear his parents driveway in Barrington on Feb. 9, 2018. Ben Brown uses a snow blower to clear his parents driveway in Barrington on Feb. 9, 2018. Stacey Wescott  Chicago Tribune With weather forecasts calling for more than a foot of snow by Friday morning, most northwest suburban public and private schools decided to close Friday, including Arlington Heights School District 25, Township High School District 214, Barrington School District 220, KildeerCountryside School District 96, Lake Zurich School District 95, LincolnshirePrairie View School District 103 and Stevenson High School.District 220 Superintendent Brian Harris said he huddled with other northwest suburban administrators, including Township High School District 214 Superintendent David Schuler, during a phone conference late Thursday afternoon, leading to a clear cut decision to close schools.Everyone thought it was a good idea to close, but each district has so many variants leading up to that decision, Harris said. We got about eight inches of snow in Barrington, which is pretty significant  and its still snowing Friday.Generally, the decision to cancel classes at District 220s 12 schools largely depends on whether students safety will be at risk during inclement weather.We have 72 square miles of road in the district, and busing is a big part of our student transportation, Harris said. We also have a lot of rural, onelane roads in Barrington Hills and North Barrington, which makes driving in the snow very challenging.Stacey Wescott  Chicago Tribune Natasha Janota, 6, of Barrington, plays in a mound of snow outside of her home in Barrington on Feb. 9, 2018. Natasha Janota, 6, of Barrington, plays in a mound of snow outside of her home in Barrington on Feb. 9, 2018. Stacey Wescott  Chicago Tribune While Arlington Heights only had around six inches of snow by Friday morning, District 25 Superintendent Lori Bein said officials were confident that closing schools was definitely the right call.Bein said she also joined in a group phone call with nearby administrators from District 214 and other area elementary schools Thursday afternoon.The consensus from the meeting was crews would not have enough time in the morning to clear the roads and allow for safe passage of school buses, as well as parents who drive their children to school, since the bulk of the snowfall was expected to arrive overnight.Its a light, soft snow, but its a significant amount, and theres more on the way, Bein said. Well just have to see what Mother Nature has in store.While some parents might see the snow day as the perfect opportunity for kids to catch up on their school work, Bein suggested that families also try to enjoy the unexpected day together at home.I think its great if families can get outside and play in the snow, and then come inside to warm up and read a good story together, or watch a family movie, Bein said.Even though area students received the day off Friday, the public works department in Arlington Heights dispatched 32 employees, who started working 12hour shifts once the snowstorm started, to plow and salt local streets, Shirley said.If the predicted snowfall for late Friday and the weekend is accurate, Shirley said, Arlington Heights would be already on par with last year, with another three to six weeks of winter weather to go.We have a lot of tools in our toolbox to deal with snow, but Mother Nature can always undo our efforts, he said.In nearby Buffalo Grove, where scores of children were out in the neighborhoods Friday afternoon enjoying the more than six inches of powdery snow, public works crews cleared roads and kept a watchful eye out for youngsters playing near the street, officials said.When the crews are out plowing in the community, theyre always keeping their eyeballs on a swivel to look our for all of the kids because the biggest piles of snow are near the street, and unfortunately, thats where the kids want to build their snow forts, said Buffalo Grove Maintenance Supervisor Bryan Beitzel.Despite the slow start to the winter season, the frequent snow flurries during the past two weeks have been keeping village crews busy lately, he said.We try to stay on a consistent schedule with the same crew 12 hours on and 12 hours off because its important that the guys have a consistent sleep schedule and sufficient downtime between shifts, Beitzel said.kcullotta@tribpub.comTwitter @kcullotta High Schools Arlington Heights Barrington

136 Chicago sees drop in percentage of teens using cigarettes Chicago sees drop in percentage of teens using cigarettes 12918 10:51 PM CHICAGO  Chicago public health officials say the citys teen youth smoking rate has fallen to an alltime low. The Chicago Department of Public Health said Monday that according to its Healthy Chicago report 6 percent of Chicago high school students reported smoking cigarettes in 2017. That number was 13.6 percent in 2011. About 7 percent of teens reported using cigars, 4.5 percent said they used smokeless tobacco and 6.6 percent reported electronic cigarette use. Health officials say serious health consequences are possible if young people use tobacco in any form. The report found a decline in use of cigarettes and electronic cigarettes among those ages 18 to 20. The number dropped from 15.2 percent in 2015 to 9.7 percent in 2016. The reductions come after Chicago passed a law raising the age for purchasing tobacco to 21 from 18. TAGS 
137 Orthopedic and Back Pain Centers of America Announces Additional of New Network Member, Illinois Sports Medicine and Orthopaedic Centers By: PRWeb via PRWeb   07:00 AM EST Orthopedic and Back Pain Centers of America Announces Additional of New Network Member, Illinois Sports Medicine and Orthopaedic Centers Orthopedic Centers of America adds prominent Chicago sports medicine practice to its network for patients ATLANTA   Orthopedic and Back Pain Centers of America OBPC, which connects people searching for solutions to their joint and back pain with a reputable physician in their area, announces the newest member of the Orthopedic and Back Pain Centers network, Illinois Sports Medicine and Orthopaedic Centers ISMOC, with multiple locations in the northern and central areas of Chicago. ISMOC helps patients who have been living with unresolved knee, shoulder, back and joint pain find lasting relief through the variety of nonsurgical and surgical options available at ISMOC. Chadwick Prodromos, MD, lead surgeon with ISMOC, is boardcertified and fellowshiptrained in both orthopedics and sports medicine. As the Author and EditorinChief of Anterior Cruciate Ligament  Reconstruction and Basic Science, Dr. Prodromos is an international leader in the diagnosis and treatment of ACL injuries with an advanced, innovative technique for knee pain that has shown a welldocumented stability rate for his patients. For patients interested in nonsurgical options, ISMOC is a national leader in the use of PRP platelet rich plasma for the treatment of arthritis and sports injuries. Dr. Prodromos received his undergraduate degree from Princeton University, and his medical degree from Johns Hopkins University. He completed his fellowship in orthopedic and sports medicine at Harvard Medical SchoolMassachusetts General Hospital and is board certified in both orthopedic surgery and regenerative medicine. We selected Illinois Sports Medicine and Orthopaedic Centers because of the medical teams reputation and their commitment to restoring mobility and health to patients, said Brent Wheeler, President of Orthopedic and Back Pain Centers of America. We are excited to have the capability of providing a fellowshiptrained, innovative physician to midwest patients who previously have not been able to resolve their pain or mobility issues. As a recognized expert in knee and shoulder minimallyinvasive surgical techniques, we are confident that many patients will gain a better quality of life. We are excited to be joining the Orthopedic and Back Pain Centers network. My surgical specialties include rotator cuff and labrum repair in the shoulder and anterior cruciate ligament and cartilage repair in the knee, said Chadwick Prodromos of Illinois Sports Medicine and Orthopaedic Centers. However, I pride myself on resorting to surgery only when absolutely necessary. To that end, we are a leading center in the use of platelet rich plasma, physical therapy and stem cell treatments for orthopedic disorders instead of surgery. We also avoid the use of habitforming drugs and, instead, utilize scientifically validated nutritional supplements. Learn more about Chicagobased, Illinois Sports Medicine and Orthopaedic Centers at ismoc.net. About Orthopedic and Back Pain Centers of America Back Pain Centers of America BPC has helped people find safe, reliable relief for chronic pain since 2009. Orthopedic Centers of America OC launched in 2017, forming the new name Orthopedic and Back Pain Centers of America. The call centers match patients searching for relief for neck and back pain to reputable, boardcertified healthcare practices in their geographic area. OBPC has the largest network of minimallyinvasive spine and joint centers in America. This service is free to patients. For more information for patients, please visit http:www.backpaincenters.com or http:www.orthopediccenters.com Also follow BPC on LinkedIn, Facebook, or Twitter. For the original version on PRWeb visit: http:www.prweb.comreleases201801prweb15100388.htm Nasdaq quotes delayed at least 15 minutes, all others at least 20 minutes. By accessing this page, you agree to the following Press Release Service provided by PRConnect. Stock quotes supplied by Six Financial

139 Emotional Chicago Cubs star Anthony Rizzo addresses Florida school shooting vigil: &apos;I grew up in Stoneman Douglas&apos; Chicago Cubs star player Anthony Rizzo became emotional at a Thursday night vigil for the victims of the Florida school shooting at his alma mater, Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, which killed 17 people and injured 14.Rizzo, who late last month was in Coral Springs for a benefit to raise money so the baseball and softball fields could receive lights, grew tearful early in his remarks at Pine Trails Park, again in the town directly south of Parkland.I grew up in Stoneman Douglas, Rizzo said. I played on those fields. I went to those classes. I studied in those classrooms.The same school we saw in all those videos yesterday for all the wrong reasons.At around 2:30 p.m. on Wednesday, Nikolas Cruz allegedly opened fire on various classrooms at Douglas.A list of all 17 people killed appears in a Broward Sheriffs Office arrest report.The names: Alyssa Alhadeff, Scott Beigel, Martin Duque, Nicholas Dworet, Aaron Feis, Jamie Guttenberg, Chris Brent Hixon, Luke Hoyer, Cara Loughran, Gina Montalto, Joaquin Oliver, Alaina Petty, Meadow Pollack, Helena Ramsey, Alex Schachter, Carmen Marie Schentrup and Peter Wang.Rizzo flew from the Cubs spring training in Arizona to participate in the event.3 Central Florida teens arrested as threats spread in wake of Parkland shooting Florida school shooter Nikolas Cruz to offer guilty plea to avoid death penalty Florida school shooting: Teacher protected her kids from chaos  and from cops Sentinel Shootings Homicide Anthony Rizzo Chicago Cubs Spring Training Stoneman Douglas High School

141 Chicago-Area Hospital Reports 8x More Flu Cases This Year Nearly 500 flu cases have been reported at Northwestern Memorial Hospital this season, according to new figures released Friday.According to the hospital, 472 total cases have been confirmed since Sept. 1, an eightfold increase over the same time period last year. Nearly 13 percent of tests for the flu virus have come back positive, compared to just 2.2 percent of tests conducted last year.With flu season still raging, the hospital has also instituted new rules about visiting patients in their facilities. Children under the age of 18 are being told not to visit patients at Northwesternaffiliated hospitals during flu season, and other areahospitals have adopted similar standards.At University of Chicago medical centers, children under the age of 12 werent allowed to visit patients, and any patient who comes to an affiliatedcenter with flulike symptoms must wear a mask, according to the hospital.This years flu season has been devastating across the country, as at 37 children have died in the United States from the flu, according to the Centers for Disease Control.

Is covered with a black ribbon below a memorial button for Chicago Police Cmdr. Paul Bauer outside the Nativity of Our Lord Catholic Church Friday, Feb. 16, 2018, in Chicago. Bauer, 53, was allegedly fatally shot by Shomari Legghette as Bauer went to assist tactical officers pursuing Legghette in downtown Chicago last Tuesday. Associated Press This undated photo provided by the Chicago Police Department shows Shomari Legghette. Legghette has been charged with firstdegree murder in the fatal shooting of Chicago Police Commander Paul Bauer. Bauer was killed after a foot chase Tuesday, Feb. 13, 2018, in downtown Chicago. He was shot in the head by a suspect carrying a semiautomatic handgun equipped with an extended clip of ammunition, a police official told The Associated Press. Bauer had been on the police force for 31 years. Paul Bauer Friday, Feb. 16, 2018, in Chicago. A massive contingent of officers from the department where Bauer worked for 31 years will attend Saturday mornings funeral at the Nativity of Our Lord Church. 145 Tech women still searching for wins at SIUE, Eastern Illinois | Herald Citizen Dont have an ID Print subscribers If youre a print subscriber, but do not yet have an online account, click here to create one. Nonsubscribers Click here to see your options for becoming a subscriber. Tech women still searching for wins at SIUE, Eastern Illinois Posted Thursday, February 1, 2018 11:33 am Tennessee Tech kicks off its final month of regularseason play on the road, traveling to Illinois. Tech tips off with SIUE on Thursday, Feb. 1 in an Education Day game at 11:30 a.m. CT and Eastern Illinois on Saturday, Feb. 3 at 1 p.m. CT. Tech returns to SIUE after facing the Cougars in Edwardsville back on New Years Eve in 2016. The Golden Eagles dropped a 6049 result but would go on to face SIUE again in the two teams opening game of the 2017 OVC Tournament in Nashville. The game marked Techs first appearance in the tournament since 2014 and its first time meeting the Cougars in the OVC Tournament. The Golden Eagles fell by a score of 7769. SIUE joined the Ohio Valley Conference in 2008 after moving up to Division I from the Division II Great Lakes Valley Conference, and so Tech has only played SIUE a total of 10 times. The Cougars hold the 64 advantage in their alltime series with Tech and also lead 32 in Edwardsville. Tech also made the trek to Eastern Illinois last February in the teams lone meeting of the season. The Panthers took the 5446 win, and Golden Eagle Asia Harper tied for the scoring lead among all players with 13 points. Tech leads Eastern Illinois 2516 in its 21year series history, but the Panthers have a slight 109 edge in Charleston. The Golden Eagles fell to Southeast Missouri and UT Martin in a pair of home games last week. Southeast Missouri defeated Tech 7066 in the two teams fourthstraight game in Cookeville decided by four points or less. The contest included a bit of history made by Tech freshman Jordan Brock , who scored a careerhigh 30 points and tied a careerhigh of seven 3pointers. Brock became just the sixthever Tech freshman to score 30 points in a game and the first in 13 years to do so the most recent freshman before Brock to score 30 was Stefanie Holbrook on Jan. 6, 2005 against Eastern Illinois. Brock received her first adidas OVC Freshman of the Week nod earlier this week. Two days later, Tech held UT Martin, one of the strongest offensive teams in the OVC, to 67 points. The Skyhawks put the game out of reach in the final quarter after making eightstraight free throws to close it out by a score of 6751. The win marked UT Martins 10 th of the last 11 games of the series. Yaktavia Shug Hickson led offensively for Tech with 20 points and a seasonhigh four 3pointers and was also two rebounds shy of a doubledouble.

147 New plaque in Illinois House commemorates Obama 2016 speech New plaque in Illinois House commemorates Obama 2016 speech 20180214T18:54:40Z 20180214T19:03:04Z Source: Pixabay SPRINGFIELD, Ill. AP  Theres a new plaque at the state capitol in Springfield commemorating President Barack Obamas 2016 speech to lawmakers in the Illinois House. The Chicago Tribune reports that the marker hangs behind the speakers podium that Obama used to give the address in February 2016. The thenpresident asked lawmakers to set aside partisan differences and work to end Illinois long budget impasse. Illinois lawmakers approved a budget last summer. The blackandgold plaque includes Obamas signature, a quote from Obama and the state seal. Information from: Chicago Tribune, http:www.chicagotribune.com Copyright 2018 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed. 
148 SEC blocks Chicago Stock Exchange sale to China-based investors February 15, 2018 at 20:20 PM EST SEC blocks Chicago Stock Exchange sale to Chinabased investors Reuters  U.S. regulators on Thursday rejected the sale of the Chicago Stock Exchange CHX to a group led by Chinabased investors, in part because they were unable to get enough information on some of the proposed buyers and the sources of their funds.
149 Illinois professor on paid leave amid accusations of filming students in bathroom January 30, 2018 at 11:03 AM EST Illinois professor on paid leave amid accusations of filming students in bathroom University of Illinois Professor Jay Rosenstein, a documentary filmmaker and vocal opponent of Native American sports mascots, was recently arrested  but not charged with a crime  for allegedly following and filming members of a proChief Illiniwek group into a bathroom during a basketball game.
150 Chelsea Clinton Visits La Grange&apos;s Anderson&apos;s Bookshop March 9 - Chicago Tribune Andersons Bookshop La Grange is delighted to present a special book signing with Chelsea Clinton. She comes to share her new book for young readers, She Persisted Around the World, and to challenge young readers to make a difference. The book celebrates 13 women from around the world who have used their voices and determination to create change and shape history.Fans can meet Clinton at Andersons Bookshop, 26 S. La Grange Rd., in downtown La Grange on Friday, March 9 at 7:00 p.m. Tickets are available exclusively at chelseaclintonandersons.brownpapertickets.com . For additional information please call Andersons Bookshop, La Grange at 7085826353. Please note: this event is a signing line event only. Candid photos will be permitted from the signing line at this special event.About the Book: This new release is the companion to Chelsea Clinton  Alexandra Boigers 1 New York Times bestseller, She Persisted: 13 American Women Who Changed the World. Perfect for tiny activists, mini feminists and little kids who are ready to take on the world. Women around the world have long dreamed big, even when theyve been told their dreams didnt matter. Theyve spoken out, risen up and fought for whats right, even when theyve been told to be quiet. Whether in science, the arts, sports or activism, women and girls throughout history have been determined to break barriers and change the status quo. They havent let anyone get in their way and have helped us better understand our world and whats possible. In She Persisted Around the World: 13 Women Who Changed History, Chelsea Clinton introduces readers to a group of thirteen incredible women who have shaped history all across the globe, including Marie Curie, Sor Juana Ines de la Cruz, Viola Desmond, Sissi Lima do Amor, Leymah Gbowee , Caroline Herschel, Wangari Maathai, Aisha Rateb, J.K. Rowling, Kate Sheppard, Yuan Tan, Mary Verghese and Malala Yousafzai . Alexandra Boigers vibrant artwork accompanies this inspiring text that shows readers of all ages that, no matter what obstacles come their way, they have the power to persist and succeed.About the Author: Chelsea Clinton is the author of the 1 New York Times bestselling picture book She Persisted: 13 American Women Who Changed the World, which was praised in a starred review by Publishers Weekly as a lovely, moving work of childrens literature and a polished introduction to a diverse and accomplished group of women. She is also the author of the New York Times bestselling Its Your World: Get Informed, Get Inspired  Get Going and, with Devi Sridhar, Governing Global Health: Who Runs the World and Why Chelsea Clinton is the Vice Chair of the Clinton Foundation, where she works on many initiatives including those that help to empower the next generation of leaders. She lives in New York City with her husband, Marc, their daughter, Charlotte, their son, Aidan, and their dog, Soren.Chelsea Clintons upcoming visit is part of Andersons Bookshops calendar of special author events. Andersons Bookshops specialize in book sales, author events, book signings, and building a sense of community, learning and fun. The store has been helping Naperville readers for six generations. Based in downtown Naperville, the store has grown with the community for more than 50 years. Other Andersons Bookshop locations include Downers Grove, at 5112 Main Street 6309632665, and La Grange, at 26 S. La Grange Rd. 7085826353, and a toy shop, Andersons Toyshop, at 111 W. Jefferson Ave., in Naperville. Key to Andersons success has been special author events, like the Friday, March 9 book signing with Chelsea Clinton.Heart transplant recipient Niki Glass Prayer service for Lane Bryant shooting victims Cubs equipment loaded for spring training in Arizona Copyright  2018, Chicago Tribune Leymah Gbowee Malala Yousafzai

153 Weather changes weekend 'Fun Run' schedule - Wandtv.com, NewsCenter17, StormCenter17, Central Illinois News- Weather changes weekend Fun Run schedule Posted: Updated: DECATUR, Ill. WAND  Rough weather created some hurdles for a Valentines Daythemed fundraiser. The part of the Valentines Day Fun Run that dealt with actual running had to be canceled because of ice and the slick surface it caused on Decatur sidewalks. While that setback kept everyone inside, it didnt stop the annual pancake breakfast from happening. The run usually includes 1 and 3 mile trips. I woke up and got up early and was like Oh, they canceled the run, said an unnamed person involved in the Fun Run. But we still got to eat and help out and meet some new people. Sundays events still included special store hours at organizer Fleet Feet Sports from 8 a.m. to 10 a.m. They, along with Ray Eldridge Jewelry, gave out raffle prizes to people who came. Donations and money from raffle ticket sales went to the track program at Millikin University. Organizers say one of the main goals of the Fun Run was to help people stay in shape.
154 Illinois Wesleyan's O'Neill named CCIW Men's Basketball Player of the Week - College Conference Of Illinois And Wisconsin NAPERVILLE, Ill.  Illinois Wesleyans Alex ONeill was selected as the College Conference of Illinois  Wisconsin CCIW Mens Basketball Player of the Week on Monday. ONeill, a sophomore center from Peoria, Illinois and Peoria Christian High School Computer Science major, helped lead the Titans to a 20 record last week. He scored 17 points on 7of10 shooting from the field, pulled down eight rebounds and added three assists in a 9263 win at Carthage on Saturday. The win clinched Illinois Wesleyan a share of its 20th CCIW title in program history and first since 2014. On Wednesday, ONeill finished with 11 points on 5of7 shooting and five rebounds in a 6556 win at Millikin. 201718 CCIW Mens Basketball Players of the Week Alex ONeill  Illinois Wesleyan 21918 Aston Francis  Wheaton 21218 Alex Sorenson  North Central 2518 Brad Kruse  Carthage 12918 Brady Rose  Illinois Wesleyan 12218 Aston Francis  Wheaton 11518 Brady Rose  Illinois Wesleyan 1818 Alex Sorenson  North Central 1218 Colin Lake  North Park 121817 Aston Francis  Wheaton 121117 Brady Rose  Illinois Wesleyan 112717 Ricky Samuelson  Wheaton 112017 Twitter  Instagram: CCIW_Athletics The College Conference of Illinois  Wisconsin CCIW was founded in 1946 and currently services nine member institutions including Augustana College Rock Island, IL, Carroll University Waukesha, WI, Carthage College Kenosha, WI, Elmhurst College Elmhurst, IL, Illinois Wesleyan University Bloomington, IL, Millikin University Decatur, IL, North Central College Naperville, IL, North Park University Chicago, IL and Wheaton College Wheaton, IL. During the 201617 academic year, the CCIW honored over 1,900 academic allconference recipients, 10 CoSIDA Academic AllAmericans, 33 CoSIDA Academic AllDistrict recipients, one CoSIDA Academic AllAmerican of the Year and over 100 allAmericans. 156 Legionella ‘Possibly’ Found in Illinois Capitol Complex Legionella Possibly Found in Illinois Capitol Complex Published at 10:20 PM CST on Jan 22, 2018 Receive the latest local updates in your inbox Email Privacy policy  More Newsletters Legionella bacteria was possibly found in the Capitol Complex hot water system, an official from the Illinois Secretary of States office said Monday. The bacteria can cause Legionnaires disease but Mike Wojcik, director of physical services for the Secretary of States office, said the department was not aware of any reports of the disease among state employees or the general public. Out of an abundance of caution and because of heightened awareness and continued misconceptions about Legionnaires disease, we want to make you aware of preliminary test results that indicate the possible presence of Legionella bacteria in the Capitol Complex hot water system, Wojcik said in a memo to all Capitol Complex state employees obtained by NBC 5. Wojcik said more testing was underway and results should be available in two weeks. In the meantime, we have been advised by experts that the transmission of this bacteria in normal, daytoday office operations is unlikely, he said in the memo. Legionnaires disease is usually contracted by inhaling mist or vapor from a contaminated water source, he said. It is not contracted through drinking water or from another person. Employees were advised to not using showers in the complex and aerators were to be removed, Wojcik said. More information on a Legionella can be found here. Get the latest from NBC Chicago anywhere, anytime Download the App Available for IOS and Android Follow NBC Chicago

158 University of Chicago - Neubauer Family Adelante Summer Scholars Program NEUBAUER FAMILY ADELANTE SUMMER SCHOLARS Thanks to the vision and the generosity of the Neubauer family, top students engaged in HispanicLatino communities can now participate in select University of Chicago Summer Session courses free of charge. The Neubauer Family Adelante Summer Scholars program brings talented rising high school seniors to the University of Chicago campus to get an early taste of an exceptional college experience. Outstanding students who share the Neubauers commitment to the HispanicLatino communities are invited to apply. Students selected will receive a full scholarship to participate in one of two Summer Session courses:  Collegiate Writing: Awakening Into Consciousness  and  Contagion: Infectious Agents and Emerging Diseases . Even if you dont plan to study English or Biology in college, being a Neubauer Family Adelante Summer Scholar is a great way to get an early look at collegelevel classes and get a feel for life on campusand to have a ton of fun in the process. Youll spend the morning gaining handson experience from teachers who are experts in their fields and the evening exploring Chicago with your classmates. I was a part of the Neubauer Adelante program and absolutely loved it I took Awakening into Consciousness and cannot begin to say how much I enjoyed the Socratic Seminar style of learningthe answers were not given, they were discovered, something that was hugely different from my high schools way of teaching, and I believe to be much more intriguing. It was here that my love for learning was fully realized. But if I were to be perfectly honest, I would have to say that the part of the program I missed most was the people I encountered. All 31 of us Neubauer scholars became unimaginably close whether it was dancing to tango, exploring the city, or simply working on essays, we were always together. I cant thank the University of Chicago enough for giving me this opportunity. Stephanie W., Waunakee High School, Waunakee, WI Details Dates: Session I: Orientation is June 1617 classes meet June 18 to July 5, 2018 Requirements Eligibility: current high school juniors Applications will be accepted online beginning in early December. The Priority deadline to apply is March 2, 2018. Rolling admissions is not offered for this program. There is no application fee to apply. Review the  Application Overview pages  for detailed information. Tuition  Fees All programs expenses are covered by the program. Updates Regarding Immigration President Robert J. Zimmer and Provost Daniel Diermeier issued a statement on January 29 confirming the Universitys commitment to our members of the community with undocumented immigration status or who qualify for relief under the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals DACA program. You may read the  entire message online  and please dont hesitate to contact us at summersession@uchicago.edu if you have any questions or concerns. 
159 Equity Commonwealth Under Contract to Sell 600 West Chicago Avenue and 1600 Market Street Nachrichtenquelle: Business Wire engl.  23.01.2018, 22:16  69  0  0 Equity Commonwealth NYSE: EQC announced today the company is under contract to sell two properties totaling 2.4 million square feet for 670 million. In January, the company entered into a contract to sell its 98.4 leased, 1,571,000 square foot property at 600 West Chicago Avenue in Chicago, Illinois, for a gross sale price of 510 million. Proceeds after credits for capital costs, contractual lease costs, and rent abatements are expected to be approximately 487 million. In December, the company entered into a contract to sell its 84 leased, 826,000 square foot property at 1600 Market Street in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, for a gross sale price of 160 million. Proceeds after credits for capital costs, contractual lease costs, and rent abatements are expected to be approximately 156 million. Pursuant to the purchase agreements, including purchaser extension rights, the closings are scheduled to occur on or before March 23, 2018 and February 28, 2018, respectively. These transactions are subject to customary closing extensions and conditions, and there is no certainty that these transactions will close. During the quarter ended December 31, 2017, the company sold 106.9 million of assets, including: A twoproperty, 15building, 1,182,000 square foot, 75.6 leased, office portfolio in Moon Township and Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, for a gross sale price of 71 million. 789 East Eisenhower Parkway, one of two adjacent office buildings in Ann Arbor, Michigan. The 100 leased, 131,000 square foot building was sold for a gross sale price of 24.9 million. 33 Stiles Lane, a 25.1 leased, 175,000 square foot industrial property in North Haven, Connecticut, for a gross sale price of 10.5 million. In connection with the sale, the company repaid the 2.0 million mortgage loan secured by the property, plus 0.2 million of prepayment costs. A land parcel in Aurora, Illinois and mineral rights in Ft. Worth, Texas for a combined gross sale price of 0.5 million. About Equity Commonwealth Equity Commonwealth NYSE: EQC is a Chicago based, internally managed and selfadvised real estate investment trust REIT with commercial office properties throughout the United States. As of December 31, 2017, EQCs sameproperty portfolio comprised 16 properties and 8.7 million square feet. We encourage investors and others interested in the company to monitor these distribution channels for material disclosures. The first period has been a bit of an adventure, but its coming around. Torrey Mitchell and Andy Andreoff scored during Los Angeles dominant start, and the Kings held off the Chicago Blackhawks for a 31 victory Monday night. Los Angeles 32225 has outscored opponents 7341 in the third this season. The Kings had to scramble in the final period against the Blackhawks, but Jonathan Quick made 12 of his 27 saves in the third to help close out the Kings second straight win since a threegame slide. Dion Phaneuf added his second goal in three games since joining Los Angeles in a trade with Ottawa, helping the Kings improve to 33 on their sevengame trip as they fight for playoff positioning in the Western Conference.Lastplace Chicago looked awful for most of the night during its ninth loss in 10 games. Anton Forsberg made 29 stops for the Blackhawks 25278, and Patrick Sharp snapped an 11game scoring drought with his seventh goal of the season.

163 Qualities Of A Reputable Firm That Offers Crane Rentals In Illinois By Joe Law Having a project running smoothly is key to ensuring that it is completed within the stipulated time. Working with a firm that can deliver credible crane services is also equally important. Before one decides to contract any specific company it is advisable they learn more on the requirements of the ideal one to hire. The tips below explain attributes of a firm that renders crane rentals in Illinois.The firm one should hire needs to have extensive experience in the field. They ought to be able to provide the kind of services and products that will enhance the results of the project one is undertaking. Companies that have been in this field for quite some time have the understanding to ensure that they deliver quality results as desired by the clients. It is crucial to inquire more about a firm before entering into a contract with it.An ideal firm should be committed to safety. Dedication to safety is very important in analyzing crane companies. The firm chosen ought to prove their understanding of all safety guidelines as stipulated by law. They need to show proof of compliance with the construction rules as part of their documentation. This is essential as it helps avoid safety incidents at the work site and enhance smooth operations.There is nothing more perilous than having the wrong person on the job in the elevator industry. A reputable firm needs to ensure that they hire the right staff with necessary skills and qualifications. They need proper training to operate the machinery, this will require them to have a valid license from recognized institutions. This is key to ensuring that work is done effectively and efficiently and within the stipulated time frame.A good company ought to be adaptive and quick in responding to circumstances. Even with proper planning and preparation, obstacles are likely to arise in crane plan services. A competent firm will anticipate any challenges and be able to react accordingly without affecting completion of the work. Experienced crane operators see to it that each project is undertaken smoothly and strive to meet the set deadlines.When looking for an ideal company for elevator rental services, it is crucial to consider a variety of cranes of available in the firm. There are major types of cranes which are specialized to perform specific jobs and also weight loads. A business which has a wide range of equipment is in a position to accomplish several jobs. They should be able to recommend the right type of equipment that will be used for a specific project.It is important considering a company which has the right operating machines suitable for specific tasks. Preferably they ought to be the most advanced ones. This will enhance smooth running of work as well as timely completion. They need to meet the standards and be serviced from time to time to prevent breakdowns during operations.A dependable firm needs to render speedy services to its customers. Operators should always be time conscious. They should be able to undertake their tasks as fast as possible and effectively. They should respond to any raised concerns swiftly. This is key to ensuring satisfied clients and greatly encourages return business.About the Author:You can get a complete overview of the advantages of using Crane Rentals In Illinois and more info about wellrespected Telehandler rentals LaSalle IL today. 
164 Chicago residents wonder if a root canal dental treatment is worth it   Chicago residents wonder if a root canal dental treatment is worth it Chicago residents wonder if a root canal dental treatment is worth it   Tooth sensitivity or tenderness is a sign of a problem and needs to be addressed. This may stem from decay or trauma. Root canal dental treatment may be a solution to preserve the health of your mouth. Unfortunately, the term root canal has a bad reputation that has many patients wondering if the treatment is worth it. Throw away the misconceptions. Located in Chicago, IL , the team at Big Smile Dental is here to disprove the bad reputation and make patients aware of the health benefits of root canal treatments. Root canals are not scary. The thought of having a root canal has many patients cringing because they fear the treatment, and believe the negativity surrounding it. Forget everything you thought to be true. A root canal is not intimidating. The treatment is performed to remove the damaged or infected dental pulp. This saves the tooth and preserves the health of the oral cavity. The procedure is as routine as having a cavity treated, and it does not cause pain. Damage or decay present in a tooth can lead to infection or inflammation. This may cause sensitivity or tenderness. Visible facial swelling is possible if the patient has an abscessed tooth. It is important to seek dental help if you experience any of these symptoms. Even if the symptoms subside, the underlying infection will not clear up on its own. Dental care is needed. What is a root canal When determining if the treatment is right for you, first get rid of your preconceived, negative ideas about root canal treatment. The goal is to relieve your pain and save your tooth. When bacteria and infection have spread throughout a tooth, the pulp inside the tooth is damaged. Without treatment, the tooth may become so damaged that it cannot be saved. When the infection is caught, a root canal is often recommended to preserve the natural tooth, thus protecting the health of your mouth. Your dentists goal is to preserve as much of your natural tooth as possible. When a root canal is performed, bacteria and affected tissue are removed, and the canal is sterilized. The tooth is saved. Using a gentle, trained touch, the entire procedure is routine and comfortable. Root canal dental treatment preserves your tooth, with long lasting health benefits. Once you have forgotten your negative thoughts about root canals, you can see the benefits of this therapy are numerous. Key points to remember about root canal therapy include: The treatment is not painful. Neither the tooth nor the root is removed. The natural tooth is saved. A root canal rids the tooth of bacteria. The effects of the treatment are long lasting with proper oral health care.   If a root canal has been suggested, it is likely that you are already experiencing sensitivity due to infection or inflammation. A root canal is a routine, everyday procedure. It is as simple as having a cavity treated. The treatment relieves the tenderness and protects your oral health. Your dentist uses xrays to show the location and depth of the damage. The damaged section is removed before the tooth is disinfected and filled. The process relieves the pressure. Your symptoms subside as the tooth heals. Your dentist strives to protect your oral health. This includes the teeth, gums, and underlying structures. The point of a root canal is to save your tooth. The roots remain in place. This keeps your jawbone healthy and prevents the surrounding teeth from shifting. During the procedure, infected material is removed to ensure the remaining bacteria are eliminated. Since the bacteria is safely removed, no infection remains to make the patient ill. Your oral and overall health are improved with a root canal dental treatment. The entire procedure is safe and effective. Once the tooth has been treated, a crown is placed on top for added protection. This preserves the health of the tooth. By following good oral practices and regular dental visits, the results of your treatment are long lasting. Dont let fear stand in the way of your beautiful smile. Contact the skilled team at Big Smile Dental in Chicago, IL. Call 7737728400 today.   Chicago residents wonder if a root canal dental treatment is worth it  
165 Illinois sets up new hotline for victims of sexual harassment Illinois sets up new hotline for victims of sexual harassment By Associated Press  Posted: Mon 2:12 PM, Feb 19, 2018 CHICAGO AP  The Illinois Department of Human Rights has set up a new hotline for victims of sexual harassment. Callers can report sexual harassment through the tollfree number, and also receive information on counseling and legal services. The departments acting director, Janice Glenn, says the hotline makes the process of finding resources and filing complaints more centralized. The Sexual Harassment Hotline Call Center can be reached Monday through Friday from 8:30 a.m. and 5 p.m. The telephone number is 8772367703. All communications with the new service are considered strictly confidential and arent subject to openrecords laws.
166 Meet American figure skater Vincent Zhou, who has been largely overshadowed by Adam Rippon and Nathan Chen - Chicago Tribune The personality of American figure skater Vincent Zhou, who made his Olympic debut with a superb short program Friday, was neatly summed up by his social media response to a fan who recently asked what era he would visit if he could travel back in time.If I time traveled, he said, I would likely end up in outer space because Earth is moving at 67,000 mph and time travel is only time travel and not spacetime travel. If you traveled back in time 1 seconds, youd be about 1,116.667 miles into space away from the surface of Earth where you were just standing. To successfully end up on Earth after time travel, science would have to find a way to make up those miles. Teleportation of matter is not possible. Yet.Clearly, this isnt your average 17yearold kid.But to answer the original question, Zhou continued in another Tweet, I would go back to 1984 to fully experience the release of Take On Me by aha.So hes not just smart, hes funny.Not just brilliant but bemusing.Part of it is from all Ive gone through, he explained. Ive gained a pretty good perspective on the world, and that helps me make appropriate and witty remarks.Despite that, Zhou has been largely overshadowed by his teammates during the Pyeongchang Olympics.The openly gay Adam Rippon has become a media darling, combining excellent skating to help the U.S. win team bronze with an unfiltered approach to interviews. The talented Nathan Chen had been tipped as a gold medal favorite until everything went awry during his short program.Together, they had held the spotlight until Zhou landed the first quad lutz in an Olympic event, and put together the best short program of his career to briefly take the lead.He wound up 12th among 30 skaters, easily qualifying for Saturdays free skate.Im happy that I committed to my jumps and Im happy that I gave it my all, Zhou said.Make no mistake, Zhou is trying to finish as high as possible during these Olympics, and a top10 result is hardly out of reach. But he also knows the next Olympics could be more his time, the moment when everything aligns and he contends for a medal.That doesnt seem so far away considering how far Zhou has already come.You see, Zhous parents emigrated from China in the early 1990s, settling in California to attend graduate school. Both became successful computer scientists in Silicon Valley, Zhous father with Google  where he still works  and his mother as a groundbreaking programmer with Oracle.It was after they had Zhou and his older sister, Vivian, that their precocious boy took an interest in figure skating. And with no toplevel coaching available in the Bay Area, the family decided that his mom, Fei Ge, would move with Zhou to Southern California in pursuit of his dream.Things became tight with only one income. Living apart from the other half of the family was tough.Zhous mother admits she thought Zhou would take figure skating to a certain level and grow tired of it, and the separation would be a shortterm arrangement. But he wound up excelling, and they would continue living and training in Southern California before moving to Colorado years later.Meanwhile, his sister became an accomplished diver, and shes now pursuing a degree in brain and cognitive science at Massachusetts Institute of Technology.My family has sacrificed absolutely everything for me, Zhou said, halfjoking that his figure skating career has made him the oddball in a family of brilliant scientists. I think thats given me more maturity than a lot of kids my age.Not that Zhou isnt smart. He graduated from high school at 16.Lots of kids his age arent pondering the scientific problems of time travel, either.The reality is Zhou has little interest in what most kids his age do. He would rather spend his time writing poetry or deep in thought, or on the practice ice trying to perfect his array of quadruple jumps.A lot of the pressure in skating does come from the outside, he said. There are fans who want to give you a standing ovation after skating a clean performance, there are people who expect you to improve and be a complete skater. Theres pressure coming from all sides. But the biggest source of pressure is from myself. Sometimes I dont show it on the outside, but Im a really ambitious person.That was evident in his quadfilled short program at the Pyeongchang Games.I always want to be the best, but I also do have a sense of realism, he said, and I know that winning the Olympics isnt really realistic. So its fortunate I dont have that pressure on myself. I cant imagine what its like for the people vying for the title. But I definitely want to put out two great performances and show people what Im capable of.It sounds cheesy, he added, but its true.American Vincent Zhou becomes first figure skater to land a quad lutz in the Olympics Japans Yuzuru Hanyu sets Olympic record in short program 2018 Winter Olympics: TV schedule and highlights Maggie Voisins final run not enough to capture slopestyle medal Nathan Chen dazzles after poor short program, finishes 5th overall Yuzuru Hanyu defends gold medal For Olympians in the quadrennial spotlight, social media can be an extreme sport Privacy Policy Copyright  2018, Chicago Tribune Figure Skating 2018 Winter Olympics
167 Gov. Bruce Rauner: Economic growth is in Illinois’ DNA http:ift.tt2nsTzZ5  Illinois boasts a brilliant legacy. It has 200 years of extraordinary accomplishments in its asset base and sets us up for an opportunity to build a truly remarkable future.It will take an uncommon level of collaboration to succeed but, as we have seen, big numbers can create a stampede of unity. Amazon brought together virtually every dissident faction in Illinois to construct a bid for a 15year, 168,000job project.The State of Illinois project is potentially just as lucrative. There is no question that we have what it takes to win the bid. The question is whether we have the will to put politics aside and roll up our sleeves to produce more jobs and better lives for the people of Illinois.Were ready for the challenge. The state has made remarkable strides in education. Weve transformed the funding formula and created funding parity for charter schools.People have already donated 45 million to our Invest in Kids tax credit scholarship program. The contributions will make it possible for children of lowerincome families to get into schools that meet their needs.The point is, we are taking the steps necessary to prepare our children to participate and prosper in the 21st century workforce.Our criminal justice reforms are aimed at joboriented outcomes, too. To be sure, there is simply no better crime deterrent than a goodpaying job. Were helping nonviolent, young offenders prepare for work after prison. The private sector is helping former offenders with apprenticeships and entrepreneur training.Along with a focus on jobs, we have been improving service to taxpayers. Weve cut fees for small business and our agencies have scissored through mountains of red tape. The idea is to get government out of the way so businesses can go to battle in the marketplace rather than fight city hall.Our tech initiatives are also helping us transform health delivery services and save us millions through Medicaid fraud detection and prevention. The dollars we are investing in these systems are paying off in greater efficiency and much better customer service. In fact, our technology initiatives are hastening response times and saving taxpayers millions of dollars.The seeds of growth have been planted. Well need the nurturing skills of one of our 72,000 farms to harvest the benefits. The heavy lifting will come when pension reform and taxes are on the agenda.The good news is we agree that pensions are out of control. They are bankrupting the state, and their unfunded liabilities are so high that retiree benefits are jeopardized. Most agree that we cannot sustain massive levels of pension spending.Many of us also agree that we cant tax our way out of trouble. Been there. Done that. Doesnt work. Property taxes, in particular, are pushing people out of house and home  and state. Time to stop sending our best people to Indiana and Wisconsin.This legislative session we need to overcome the politics and unite behind a jobs agenda. I am confident we can do it. It is in our DNA.Throughout its history, Illinois has been a magnet. If you wanted to till the soil, lay a brick, build a building, make a deal, supercompute, you name it  you could find work in Illinois, afford a home, and rely on the public schools to educate your children.In this Bicentennial year, we have an opportunity to turn yesterday into tomorrow, and make Illinois the powerhouse job creator it should be.Weve started the job. Today well be asking the people of Illinois and the legislature to help us finish it.Bruce Rauner is the governor of Illinois. He is scheduled to give his State of the State address at noon Wednesday.  
168 Agudath Israel of Illinois Lauds Bi-Partisan Solution to Scholarship Tax Credit Program Impasse On Friday, January 26, Illinois Governor Bruce Rauner announced the adoption of a policy to include previously excluded schools in Illinois new tax credit scholarship program, the Invest in Kids Act. The breakthrough came after the Rauner administration, a bipartisan group of lawmakers, the Illinois State Board of Education ISBE, the Illinois Department of Revenue IDOR, and advocates including Agudath Israel of Illinois worked together to find an expedient way to include as many of these schools as possible without compromising the integrity of the program.The Invest in Kids Act was part of an historic bipartisan school funding bill signed in 2017 which included a 100 million scholarship tax credit program for low and middleincome families. Unfortunately, a provision in the law that requires schools to be recognized by ISBE, prevented 257 registered schools, many of which cater to disadvantaged children, from participating in the program. Since the most recent official list of recognized schools is from 2016, this provision excluded schools that applied for recognition but have not yet been approved, and even schools that are currently recognized, but not on ISBEs 2016 list. As a result, students who wished to attend highquality schools, including some Jewish schools, were not eligible to receive scholarships.After weeks of discussions between the aforementioned parties including Agudath Israel of Illinois AIOI, ISBE generated a new updated list of recognized schools that include all schools that were recognized in 2017 and allowed schools that have a recognition visit scheduled to provisionally participate pending the outcome of ISBEs visit.In a statement released by the Governors office, advocates, including AIOI, were acknowledged and Quote: d. Following discussions with stakeholders, a solution ensuring the participation of all schools that become recognized was achieved, said Rabbi Shlomo Soroka, AIOIs director of government affairs. Agudath Israel of Illinois thanks the Rauner Administration, the bipartisan group of legislators, the Illinois State Board of Education, the Illinois Department of Revenue, and advocates, who worked together to provide quality educational options to more students.
169 A Republican PR disaster looms in Illinois  Clueless punditry on inflation and the stock market  The stock drop was hardly historic 
170 This is History: 1st Chicago Rolling Bridge, Capone Goes to Prison, Monopoly Debuts, RCA Issues First 45RPM Record, Chicago’s Daily Defender Begins Publishing, Super Bowl XLI Dave Plier and Dave Schwan talk about the 1st Chicago rolling lift bridge in 1895, the Knights of Columbus is formed, Al Capone is sent to prison, RCA issues the first ever 45rpm single, Chicagos Daily Defender begins publishing, Mel Brooks Blazing Saddles debuts and the Bears lose to the Colts in Super Bowl XLI. http:serve.castfire.comaudio34588783458878_20180128061518.64kmono.mp3ad_paramszones3DPreroll7Cstation_id3D3748.mp3 
171 Boston Financial Mangement LLC Lowers Position in Illinois Tool Works Inc. (ITW) Boston Financial Mangement LLC Lowers Position in Illinois Tool Works Inc. ITW Posted by Anthony Miller  Feb 7th, 2018 Boston Financial Mangement LLC cut its holdings in Illinois Tool Works Inc. NYSE:ITW by 2.4 in the fourth quarter, according to the company in its most recent disclosure with the Securities and Exchange Commission SEC. The firm owned 63,480 shares of the industrial products companys stock after selling 1,575 shares during the quarter. Boston Financial Mangement LLCs holdings in Illinois Tool Works were worth 10,592,000 as of its most recent SEC filing. Other large investors have also added to or reduced their stakes in the company. Cetera Investment Advisers bought a new position in Illinois Tool Works in the second quarter worth about 601,000. Quantbot Technologies LP raised its holdings in Illinois Tool Works by 71.3 in the second quarter. Quantbot Technologies LP now owns 25,132 shares of the industrial products companys stock worth 3,600,000 after purchasing an additional 10,457 shares in the last quarter. Parametric Portfolio Associates LLC raised its holdings in Illinois Tool Works by 100.8 in the second quarter. Parametric Portfolio Associates LLC now owns 1,409,208 shares of the industrial products companys stock worth 201,869,000 after purchasing an additional 707,287 shares in the last quarter. First Trust Advisors LP raised its holdings in Illinois Tool Works by 72.8 in the third quarter. First Trust Advisors LP now owns 357,404 shares of the industrial products companys stock worth 52,881,000 after purchasing an additional 150,570 shares in the last quarter. Finally, Fiduciary Trust Co. raised its holdings in Illinois Tool Works by 5.9 in the second quarter. Fiduciary Trust Co. now owns 137,960 shares of the industrial products companys stock worth 19,763,000 after purchasing an additional 7,662 shares in the last quarter. 74.61 of the stock is owned by institutional investors. Get Illinois Tool Works alerts: A number of brokerages have commented on ITW. Argus reiterated a buy rating and issued a 180.00 target price up from 160.00 on shares of Illinois Tool Works in a report on Tuesday, October 24th. Seaport Global Securities reiterated a buy rating and issued a 200.00 target price on shares of Illinois Tool Works in a report on Thursday, January 25th. BMO Capital Markets boosted their target price on shares of Illinois Tool Works to 180.00 and gave the stock an outperform rating in a report on Wednesday, December 6th. Stifel Nicolaus boosted their target price on shares of Illinois Tool Works from 176.00 to 186.00 and gave the stock a hold rating in a report on Tuesday, January 16th. Finally, Credit Suisse Group reduced their target price on shares of Illinois Tool Works from 142.00 to 140.00 and set a neutral rating for the company in a report on Tuesday, October 24th. One investment analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, ten have given a hold rating and eight have assigned a buy rating to the companys stock. The stock currently has a consensus rating of Hold and an average target price of 177.18. In related news, insider Roland M. Martel sold 64,818 shares of the companys stock in a transaction that occurred on Monday, December 4th. The stock was sold at an average price of 167.41, for a total value of 10,851,181.38. Following the sale, the insider now owns 26,222 shares in the company, valued at 4,389,825.02. The sale was disclosed in a legal filing with the SEC, which is available through this link . Also, insider Harold B. Smith sold 30,000 shares of the companys stock in a transaction that occurred on Friday, December 8th. The shares were sold at an average price of 166.43, for a total value of 4,992,900.00. The disclosure for this sale can be found here . In the last 90 days, insiders have sold 113,468 shares of company stock worth 19,163,781. Corporate insiders own 0.90 of the companys stock. Illinois Tool Works Inc.  NYSE:ITW  opened at 164.14 on Wednesday. Illinois Tool Works Inc. has a fiftytwo week low of 126.52 and a fiftytwo week high of 179.07. The company has a current ratio of 2.38, a quick ratio of 1.98 and a debttoequity ratio of 1.63. The stock has a market cap of 56,230.00, a PE ratio of 33.84, a PEG ratio of 2.19 and a beta of 1.18. Illinois Tool Works NYSE:ITW last posted its quarterly earnings data on Wednesday, January 24th. The industrial products company reported 1.70 earnings per share EPS for the quarter, beating the Thomson Reuters consensus estimate of 1.62 by 0.08. Illinois Tool Works had a net margin of 11.79 and a return on equity of 48.42. The firm had revenue of 3.63 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of 3.54 billion. During the same quarter in the prior year, the company posted 1.39 earnings per share. The companys revenue for the quarter was up 6.8 compared to the same quarter last year. sellside analysts forecast that Illinois Tool Works Inc. will post 7.71 EPS for the current year. About Illinois Tool Works Illinois Tool Works Inc is a manufacturer of industrial products and equipment. The Company operates through seven segments. The Automotive OEM segment produces components and fasteners for automotiverelated applications. The Food Equipment segment offers commercial food equipment. The Test  Measurement and Electronics segment produces test and measurement, and electronic manufacturing and maintenance, repair and operations MRO solutions.
